special_features: What Has 'The Romans' Ever Done For Us?
Dennis Spooner - Wanna Write a Television Series?
Coming Soon Trailer - Attack of the Cybermen

notes: This was the first story played for comedy as well as drama.
Negative film prints of all episodes exist and were recovered by the BBC in 1978.
Telesnaps of this story are held by private collectors.

Dennis Spooner's original idea was to spoof the film Quo Vadis; however the cinematic release, before the serial's broadcast, of Carry On Cleo (which took inspiration from the same film) led him to choose the time of the Great Fire of Rome as his setting.
This story begins with the TARDIS crew having been in the villa for a long time—approximately one month, as indicated and explained in dialogue.
The Rescue leads directly into this story.

continuity_notes: After leaving Rome, the Doctor and his companions travelled to London in the early 20th century.
The Tenth Doctor later told Donna Noble that he was not responsible ('well, not exactly...') for Rome burning.

plot.plot_summary: The TARDIS crew land in Rome in 64 AD and while Ian and Barbara are content to relax, the Doctor and Vicki pursue adventure. The Doctor impersonates the musician Maximus Pettulian and is taken to the court of Nero, where he inadvertently becomes entangled in a conspiracy. Meanwhile, Ian and Barbara are kidnapped by slave traders. The Doctor saves Nero from being poisoned, but unwittingly gives Nero the idea to burn down Rome. In the end, the Doctor and his companions escape as Rome burns.
